bibl.title: Dispatch from F.W. Seward to George G.L., January 22, 1862
Despatches from United States Consuls in Gaboon, 1856-1888 T-466

text.body:
<pb facs="20170615_105437"
Department of State Washington Jany 22nd, 1862
United States Commercial Agent at the Gaboon
Sir:
The President having appointed you Commercial Agent of the United States at the Gaboon.
I transmit you a printed copy of the Consular Regulations, to which your immediate and careful attention is invited: a form of the Consular bond, to be executed at once and sent to this Department, and other documents for the use of your Consulate, of which a list is subjoined.
As soon as yout bond is recieved and approved your Passport will be transmitted to you, and your Certificate of appointment.
You will communicate to the Department the name of the State or County in which you were born, also of the State from which you have been appointed, and if you have ever visited in Gaboon.
I am sir respectfully, Your obident servant, T.W.Seward
